mean_cn: n.因纽特人；  adj.因纽特人的
mean_en: a member of a people inhabiting the Arctic (northern Canada or Greenland or Alaska or eastern Siberia); the Algonquians called them Eskimo (`eaters of raw flesh\u0027) but they call themselves the Inuit (`the people\u0027)
sentence: "The Inuit live around the North Pole
sentence_trans: 这个因纽特人住北极附近，吃鱼和海豹，穿海豹皮大衣。
